title: Leadership Structure Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of organizational leadership structures within The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each leadership structure (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

hierarchical.description: Multi-level chain of command with clear reporting relationships and progressively narrowing authority toward the top.

flat.description: Minimal management layers with most members having similar authority and responsibility levels.

democratic.description: Leadership determined through voting or consensus-building among members or stakeholders.

autocratic.description: Power concentrated in a single individual who makes decisions with minimal consultation.

council_based.description: Leadership vested in a group of individuals who make decisions collaboratively.

cellular.description: Organization divided into semi-autonomous units with local leadership and limited central coordination.

meritocratic.description: Leadership positions earned through demonstrated skill, achievement, or contribution.

dynastic.description: Leadership passed down through family lines or designated successors.

technocratic.description: Leadership determined by technical expertise or specialized knowledge.

dual_leadership.description: Power shared between two distinct leaders or offices, often with different but complementary responsibilities.

collective.description: Decision-making distributed across the entire membership with emphasis on full participation.

leaderless.description: No formal leadership positions, with coordination emerging from member interactions and shared principles.

rotating.description: Leadership positions that change hands periodically according to predetermined schedules or criteria.

matrix.description: Complex structure where individuals report to multiple leaders across different functional areas.

theocratic.description: Leadership derived from religious authority or divine mandate.

ai_directed.description: Key strategic or operational decisions made or heavily influenced by artificial intelligence systems.
